author: Chris Oryschak
comment: Feb 21: finally no longer crashing. super happy to have this app back  Update Jan27: Still crashing on load. running Galaxy S7 on Android 7.0  Update jan 13 2018: the latest update released has caused the app to no longer work. every time i start it.. it crashes.   Old review: works really well. I have a problem where it won't connect to my server if I'm over 3G. the moment i'm on WiFi the connection is established...

author: Paul Janssens
comment: Moto G5 with Android 7.0 now likes the app again. Thanks for the fix

reply.author: 3hou.se
reply.content: Sorry problem and for the delay of the bugfix.

author: Dmitry Jerusalimsky
comment: It crashes every time on launch with latest Android 8.1.0

author: Mihir Patil
comment: The controller does not work with more than 2 rows

reply.author: 3hou.se
reply.content: Thanks for notifying me. Will take a look at it ASAP

author: Giles Spungin
comment: Android version 6.0.1. Used to work perfectly fine, now crashes after any action (for example switch selection). please fix. UDPATE: no longer crashes on switch selection. Back to 5 stars

reply.author: 3hou.se
reply.content: Glad that the latest set of patches fixed the problem

title: constantly crashes after last update

author: nurettin alp
comment: When click a switch program shutdown.
title: Crash android 6

author: Chris B
comment: Was looking forward to this working,  but it can't find the server. Bit of a waste of time.  Hopefully it gets fixed.

reply.author: 3hou.se
reply.content: Can't you find it with the scanner? It might be that zeroconf isn't working correctly on the pi

title: Cannot find local raspberry server

author: Mike O
comment: Was a great app for more custom setups. I realize you broke the database with the 5.* release and I can get past that but when I send a volume change request for my squeezebox it sends the console into a tailspin. I can email you the error on request. The web interface and official app work as intended.

author: Sam Turner
comment: Better documentation is needed, or more descriptive text on what things do. It seems there is quite a lot this app can do and the controllers look particularly useful. But each time I try to set it up I have limited success and end up uninstalling the app either in frustration, or because there is a rogue widget or notification that I can't remove any other way.
title: Needs better documentation

author: Timo Aho
comment: This one is a hundredfold more responsive than the offical one. Plus I dont need Tasker anymore for widgets.
title: Excellent

author: Chad Dybdahl
comment: This looks really interesting, but I can't get the app to find my server, which is running on a nonstandard port. Is this supported?

author: Verger Alle-sur-semois
comment: Crashes since the last update, used to work fine on my moto g1.

author: Brenda Wallace
comment: Doesn't do valuecolor or labelcolor. Otherwise flawless.

author: kyawlin aung
comment: Good application.Faster than openhab original app and can control multipel openhab server.Love it
title: Home automation

author: William Garrido
comment: Love it but seems like I can't connect over SSL. Works fine at home over http. Other app works fine.
title: Looks great

author: Benedict Smith
comment: But especially great for making button widgets :) thanks Mattias
title: Much goodness

author: Stephen Howell
comment: Looks good in these screenshots but crashes on load on tablet & phone

reply.author: 3hou.se
reply.content:
Uploaded a fix a couple of minutes (Downloadable in a day or so). 
It should probably solve the problem.

author: Mr F
comment: Selain dari versi original, ini kedua terbaik! Suis-suis rumahku kini automatik, terima kasih tak terhingga!
title: Terbaik!

author: Kyle Haefner
comment: Better than the openhab app!

author: Aaron Sutton
comment: I am totally unable to connect to my openHAB server. Is this because I'm using https? openHAB app connects without issue, so I know my server is fine.

reply.author: 3hou.se
reply.content: Hi Aaron. The app now supports self signed certificates. You should be golden.

title: Doesn't seem to work at all

author: Paul Muldoon
comment: Great app and love the ability to add multiple servers.  But had to give 4 stars only as was unable to access via https when HabDroid can.
title: https not working

author: Steven Daglish
comment: Update seems to fix connection issues. Overall looks good and numbers and switched seem to be working well.   Charts not showing yet. Frame and sitemap titles are shown on the same line causing some of the text to be off the screen.   So far looking better than the official app! Keep up the good work.

reply.author: 3hou.se
reply.content:
Hi. Yeah it seems like a couple of users have received this error.
Will have a path out in 3-4 days.

title: Looking good

comment: Thank you.Good job team
